verses.verse: And now I plead with you, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment to you, but that which we have had from the beginning: ((John 13:34, 35; 15:12, 17); 1 John 3:11; 4:7, 11) that we love one another.
(John 14:15; 1 John 2:5; 5:3) This is love, that we walk according to His commandments. This is the commandment, that (1 John 2:24) as you have heard from the beginning, you should walk in it.

Beware of Antichrist Deceivers For (1 John 2:19; 4:1) many deceivers have gone out into the world (1 John 4:2) who do not confess Jesus Christ as coming in the flesh. (1 John 2:22) This is a deceiver and an antichrist.
(Mark 13:9) Look to yourselves, (Gal. 3:4) that we do not lose those things we worked for, but that we may receive a full reward.
(John 7:16; 8:31; 1 John 2:19, 23, 24) Whoever transgresses and does not abide in the doctrine of Christ does not have God. He who abides in the doctrine of Christ has both the Father and the Son.
If anyone comes to you and (1 Kin. 13:16; Rom. 16:17; 2 Thess. 3:6, 14; Titus 3:10) does not bring this doctrine, do not receive him into your house nor greet him;
for he who greets him shares in his evil deeds.

Johnâ€™s Farewell Greeting (3 John 13, 14) Having many things to write to you, I did not wish to do so with paper and ink; but I hope to come to you and speak face to face, (John 17:13) that our joy may be full.
(1 Pet. 5:13) The children of your elect sister greet you. Amen.
Greeting to Gaius The Elder, To the beloved Gaius, (2 John 1) whom I love in truth:
Beloved, I pray that you may prosper in all things and be in health, just as your soul prospers.
For I (2 John 4) rejoiced greatly when brethren came and testified of the truth that is in you, just as you walk in the truth.
I have no greater (1 Thess. 2:19, 20; 2 John 4) joy than to hear that ((1 Cor. 4:15)) my children walk in truth.
Gaius Commended for Generosity Beloved, you do faithfully whatever you do for the brethren and for strangers,
